summary: A compilation of news articles from January 30, 2020, covering multiple Southern District of New York cases, including updates on the Epstein case guards' trial, Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation, and other unrelated legal matters like Michael Avenatti's extortion trial and Harvey Weinstein's sexual assault trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused financier and convicted sex offender
persons.context: Deceased financier whose suicide in jail is central to the case against guards Michael Thomas and Tova Noel. He was accused of trafficking underage girls.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: One of two guards charged with faking inmate checks at the Manhattan Correctional Center the night Epstein died. His lawyer plans a selective prosecution defense.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Second guard charged alongside Thomas for failing to check on inmates, including Epstein, and falsifying records.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: Attorney for guard Michael Thomas, stated intent to file a motion to dismiss based on selective prosecution.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Attorney for guard Tova Noel, engaged in a heated exchange with Judge Torres over the trial date.

persons.name: Analisa Torres
persons.context: Judge presiding over the guards' case, set a June 22 trial date and admonished attorney Jason Foy.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Prosecutor in the guards' case, informed the court that both defendants are engaged in plea talks.

persons.name: Nicolas Roos
persons.context: Prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York working on the guards' case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York, whose friendship with Epstein is under scrutiny. U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated he had provided zero cooperation to the FBI.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who stated Prince Andrew had not cooperated with the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's ex-girlfriend and alleged conspirator. A former police officer described her visits to Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Paul Page
persons.context: Former protection agent for Prince Andrew (1998-2004) who spoke about procedures for Ghislaine Maxwell's visits. Noted his 2009 fraud conviction.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing some of Epstein's alleged victims, stated she would try to subpoena Prince Andrew if he entered the U.S.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Lawyer on trial for allegedly attempting to extort Nike. Witness testified Avenatti said he didn't care about ruining teenage basketball players' lives.

persons.name: Scott Wilson
persons.context: Nike attorney who testified about Avenatti's alleged extortion attempts, recounting shocking meetings and recorded calls.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Disgraced Hollywood producer on trial for sexual assault. Prosecutors contrasted his current frail appearance with his past powerful physique.

persons.name: Meghan Hast
persons.context: Manhattan prosecutor who gave opening statements in the Weinstein trial, describing him as a 'hulking, towering figure'.

persons.name: Annabella Sciorra
persons.context: Actress who testified Weinstein raped her in the 1990s, describing the physical power imbalance.

persons.name: Tarale Wulff
persons.context: Witness who testified Weinstein raped her in 2005, describing how his size overpowered her.

persons.name: Mimi Haleyi
persons.context: Witness who testified Weinstein raped her in 2006.

persons.name: Lev Parnas
persons.context: Former associate of Rudy Giuliani charged with illegal campaign contributions. New audio placed him at a 2018 dinner with President Trump.

persons.name: Igor Fruman
persons.context: Business partner of Lev Parnas, charged alongside him.

persons.name: Joseph A. Bondy
persons.context: Attorney for Lev Parnas who released audio of Parnas at a dinner with President Trump.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Featured in audio from a 2018 fundraising dinner with Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman. Also referenced in impeachment context.

persons.name: Pete Sessions
persons.context: Believed to be 'Congressman One' in the Parnas indictment; was at the 2018 dinner with Trump and discussed midterm prospects.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Former NYC mayor and Trump's attorney who allegedly used Parnas as a fixer in Ukraine.

persons.name: John Bolton
persons.context: Mentioned in opinion piece regarding the Senate impeachment trial, with the author suggesting he possesses damaging evidence against Trump.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Attorney for President Trump during impeachment, referenced for his expansive theory of presidential power.

persons.name: Virgil Griffith
persons.context: Ethereum developer who pleaded not guilty to conspiring to violate sanctions by speaking at a cryptocurrency conference in North Korea.

persons.name: Brian Klein
persons.context: Attorney for Virgil Griffith, stated his client should not have been indicted.

persons.name: Michael Krouse
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Virgil Griffith case.

persons.name: P. Kevin Castel
persons.context: Judge presiding over the Virgil Griffith case.

persons.name: William R. Grogg
persons.context: Businessman charged with failing to pay payroll taxes and obstructing the IRS.

persons.name: Stormy Daniels
persons.context: Porn star represented by Michael Avenatti in a case against President Trump. Avenatti also faces allegations of stealing from her.

connections.description: Both guards are charged together for allegedly failing to check on inmates (including Epstein) and falsifying records on the night of his death.
Figgins is the defense attorney representing guard Michael Thomas.
Foy is the defense attorney representing guard Tova Noel.
Prince Andrew's friendship with Epstein is a central subject of the scandal and investigation.
Former protection agent Paul Page described procedures for Maxwell's visits to Prince Andrew, indicating a social connection.
Business partners charged together with conspiring to make illegal campaign contributions.
Audio and photos place Parnas at a fundraising dinner with President Trump in 2018.
Parnas hired Giuliani for a business venture and was later used by Giuliani as a fixer in Ukraine.
Avenatti previously represented Stormy Daniels, but also faces allegations of stealing from her.

events.title: Epstein Guards Trial Date Set
events.description: Judge Analisa Torres postponed the trial for guards Michael Thomas and Tova Noel to June 22, 2020. Defense attorney Montell Figgins indicated plans to file a motion to dismiss based on selective prosecution.

events.title: Berman Says Prince Andrew Not Cooperating
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated in a press conference that Prince Andrew had provided 'zero cooperation' to the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation, contradicting Andrew's public offers to help.

events.title: Night of Epstein's Death
events.description: The night guards Thomas and Noel allegedly failed to check on inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, at the Manhattan Correctional Center. Epstein was found dead from suicide on the morning of August 10.

events.title: Avenatti Extortion Trial Testimony
events.description: Second day of testimony in Michael Avenatti's trial, where Nike attorney Scott Wilson testified about Avenatti's alleged attempts to extort $20 million from Nike, including recorded calls.

events.title: Weinstein Trial Testimony
events.description: Continued testimony in Harvey Weinstein's sexual assault trial, with accusers describing his physical dominance. Prosecutors emphasized his past powerful physique versus his current frail appearance.

events.title: Trump Fundraising Dinner with Parnas
events.description: Audio released shows Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman attending a fundraising dinner with President Trump at Mar-a-Lago. Trump is heard discussing midterm elections and oil in Syria.

events.title: Virgil Griffith Pleads Not Guilty
events.description: Ethereum developer Virgil Griffith pleaded not guilty to conspiracy for allegedly teaching North Korea how to use cryptocurrency to evade sanctions.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly stated Prince Andrew had provided 'zero cooperation' to the FBI in the Epstein investigation, despite Andrew's public offers.

The trial for Epstein jail guards Michael Thomas and Tova Noel was postponed to June 22, 2020, with Thomas's lawyer planning a selective prosecution defense, arguing up to 100 guards worked under similar conditions.
A former protection agent for Prince Andrew, Paul Page, claimed Ghislaine Maxwell's visits to the prince were not recorded in the official guest book, per instructions from the privy purse.
In the Harvey Weinstein trial, prosecutors focused on contrasting Weinstein's current frail appearance with his past powerful physique to counter the image of a 'harmless old man'.
New audio evidence placed Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman at a 2018 fundraising dinner with President Trump, as Parnas faced charges for illegal campaign contributions.
